title: SGA on Omniglot
content:
Omniglot, a website devoted to all written languages - including made-up ones - has a page for Standard Galactic Alphabet! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

It also has lots of other fantasy and alien alphabets (such as Klingon, and the Futurama Alien Alphabet), so if you're into alien alphabets (as I'm sure many of you are), check it out.

[url=http://www.omniglot.com/writing/sga.htm]Omniglot - SGA and others[/url]

There's also an alphabet called "Gargish" which I thought would be the SGA at first, but it turns out it's just a Gargoyle script. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: SGA on Omniglot
content:
Someone posted about this a long time ago! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But it doesn't matter, it's pretty cool.

As for Gargish, it's here;
[url=http://www.omniglot.com/writing/gargish.htm]www.omniglot.com/writing/gargish.htm[/url]3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:
